exercises.question: Arrange these phrases in the correct order to make a story
exercises.solution: The correct order forms a simple story: 'Once upon a time there was a little girl who loved to read books in her garden every sunny afternoon.'

exercises.question: Unscramble the words to make a complete sentence
exercises.solution: The correct sentence is 'The dog sleeps at night', where each word is placed in its proper position to form a grammatically correct statement.

exercises.question: Put the letters in order to spell what's in the image
exercises.solution: The image shows a dog, and the letters should be arranged in the order 'd', 'o', 'g' to spell the word correctly.

sections.title: Story Sequencing
sections.description: Learn how to arrange phrases to create coherent narratives. Focus on temporal order and logical flow.

examples.explanation: Notice how the sequence follows a chronological order, starting with the morning and ending with sunset.
examples.tip: Look for time indicators and natural progression of events

sections.title: Sentence Structure
sections.description: Practice arranging words to form grammatically correct sentences. Understanding basic sentence patterns.

examples.explanation: Basic English sentences follow Subject + Verb + Object structure.
examples.pattern: Article + Adjective + Noun + Verb + Possessive + Noun
examples.tip: Identify the main verb and build around it

sections.title: Word Building
sections.description: Learn to arrange letters to form words, with focus on common spelling patterns.

examples.explanation: Simple three-letter words often follow a consonant-vowel-consonant pattern.
examples.tip: Look at the image and sound out the word
